reviews.title: PERFECT place to stay in Rome!
reviews.text: When my boyfriend and I reserved a room at Daphne B&B, we received an email shortly after explaining how to get to Daphne, what to see in Rome, and if we needed ANY tours booked or questions answered, to let them know. They even booked our tours of Vatican City and Ancient Rome before we even got there.

reviews.title: Personal care and attention
reviews.text: The staff are all fluent in English and go above and beyond the standard to help their visitors! Upon arriving, they gave us a cell phone to use in case of emergency, and they gave us a map of Rome. Daphne is in such a prime location and is within walking distance of everything! (We stayed at the Daphne Trevi -- they have another location close by). The staff members even highlighted all the places on the map that we should see, which streets to walk, and recommended fabulous places to eat, have gelato, and coffee. They also gave us print-outs of our tour confirmations as well as maps of the meeting places for these tours.

reviews.title: Friendly, but not private
reviews.text: The room and bathroom was very clean and recently remodeled. It even had air conditioning, a VERY comfortable bed, a digital safe, and a small outdoor terrace for each room.

reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at the Daphne
reviews.text: Breakfast was also wonderful -- coffee, cappucino, juices, pastries, meats, cheeses, and fruits. And even if you can't make the breakfast time (8-10am), they will give you breakfast to-go, or they will give you a voucher for the cafe next door to pick up breakfast there.

reviews.title: Location, location, location!!
reviews.text: And there is FREE internet access 24 hours a day in the common area!

reviews.title: Excellent Service, Nice Rooms, Some Noise
reviews.text: If you are looking for above average accomodations and superior service, stay here! The owner, Alexandro, makes the Trevi an enjoyable and must stay in Rome. His passion and enthusiasm for Rome is incredible -- and his advice for walking, eating and sightseeing -- truly makes the vacation. Add to that clean new rooms, 24 hr internet and good breakfast, and you do not even notice the stairs up.

reviews.title: Absolutely Loved the Daphne
reviews.text: Our only complaint is the noise -- not from the street, but from the other apartments and restaurant below (much below) -- as well as from the kitchen in the AM. Perhaps just a bad room location.

reviews.title: Bravo Daphne Trevi!
reviews.text: Would highly recommend the Daphne for your trip to Rome. Service is incredible! Location is top notch (very close to Metro) and very easy to get to from all parts of Rome.

reviews.title: Daphne Trevi is wonderful!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Daphne for 9 nights, (7 nights in the beginning, and then 2 nights at the end of our Italian trip), and have to say that we would recommend this B&B to anyone who wants a quiet, comfortable room with staff that truly seems to care about providing not only a fabulous vacation, but a home away from home! We were married in Italy, and had lots to worry about before ever arriving in Rome -- Sandra and Elyssa helped us plan our trip months in advance, and provided possible itineraries, of which worked fabulously! Everything was arranged for -- transportation from the airport, to the train station, etc...we had nothing to worry about, and when there was a glitch with my train schedule, one of the staff took her personal time to walk my husband to the travel agent, and sit with him until the matter was resolved. But, then there's all the small touches that meant the world -- flowers in the room, capuccino in the morning, packed breakfast for days that we left early, unbelievably comfortable beds, and as always -- the friendly staff :-)

reviews.title: Yet another positive review!
reviews.text: We're already thinking of planning our next Roman Holiday.

We spent 3 nights at the Daphne Trevi at the end of June. We had a wonderful experience. The room was immaculate and the service was great. The girls there were all so helpful in planning our days with us. Naraya was especially wonderful. One morning she even waited for us after breakfast had ended, knowing that we had slept late after a heavy day of walking. She made us cappuccino when we woke up and began putting out some breakfast for us. That really was nice, not something you would find in a larger hotel. All in all the Daphne was a great place and we will definitley return.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience
Great Place to stay in Rome!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Daphne 3 days, 2 weeks ago. And we fully recommend this place. In addition to its perfect location, at walking distance to most of the Rome landmarks, the B&B is also delightful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and they offer the kind of attention and personalized services that you will rarely find in other hotels!

reviews.title: Very good, but not for the usual reasons
reviews.text: The staff is great, they give very useful advices, suggest and reserve fine restaurants, book tours and make you feel very comfortable.

reviews.title: Overall Nice Experience
reviews.text: Big Thanks to Naraya and Elena at The Daphne Trevi desk.

We recently stayed at the Daphne Trevi and were very pleased with the accomodations. For those looking for luxury and hotel-oriented service, this is not the place for you. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but they are not "hotel" rooms. It is really like having a studio apartment, with clean up service daily. We did not visit the newer veneto location, but as for the trevi location, it is located inside of what appeared to be an office or residential building. This is not a negative, just a heads up if you were expecting a "hotel".
reviews.title: The Daphne was hot..but fantastic
Sweet Little Gem
reviews.text: Daphne Inn’s trademark is exceptional service and the staff went beyond expectations to make our vacation enjoyable and relaxing. My partner & I visited Rome for 6 nights and stayed at the Daphne Inn near Trevi Fountain. A friend of ours who recently visited Rome recommended Daphne Inn to us – and we were not disappointed. Daphne Inn began their sincere hospitability with their email confirmation, with offering to make bookings/reservations at certain museums if we were interested before we arrived. When we arrived in the evening, a staff member sat down with us and made suggestions to restaurants for dinner and volunteered to call ahead to make reservations for us. We were given a cell phone to use during our stay – and with a map highlighted to specific sights. Although our room was off the common breakfast room, we still felt secluded and the room was quiet and very home-like. The bed ROCKED – very comfortable. We also traveled to Siena and Florence – and Daphne Inn had the most comfortable bed and room.

reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
reviews.text: All in all, we felt as if Daphne Inn was our home away from home. The staff overall were sincerely friendly and helpful. As a gay couple, Daphne Inn was very welcoming and even suggested neighborhoods and bars. We also had the best breakfast at Daphne as we planned out the day’s adventures. Naraya – we adore you and cannot thank you enough for all of your help and laughter. And you’re right; we couldn’t stop looking up at the beauty in Siena.

reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!
reviews.text: The hotel is in a little cobbled side street which is very quiet. We stayed here for a week and returned yesterday. Our room was very bright, clean and nicely decorated with a very comfortable bed. We stayed in an en-suite room on the first floor. There was no view but that didn't matter.

reviews.title: Stay at Daphne!
reviews.text: The breakfast is continental and includes fruit, meats, croissants, bread, yoghurts, various teas and coffees etc and is served in the breakfast room on the second floor. This is a nice way to get to know the other guests at the hotel if you wish and to swap information about where to go and sometimes more importantly when to go to avoid queues etc.

reviews.title: Quite possibly one of the best places I've ever stayed
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is ideal. Two minutes walk from Barberini metro. Two minutes walk from Trevi. Five minutes walk from the Spanish Steps. Near to clothes shops, food shops, restaurants, pubs, tobacconists etc. You name it and it is probably nearby.
